remarks: If two structures have the same base set, and the values of their group (addition) operations are equal for all pairs of elements of the base set, one is a monoid iff the other one is.  (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 6-Jan-2015.)
statement:
mndpropd.1 $e |- ( ph -> B = ( Base ` K ) ) $.
mndpropd.2 $e |- ( ph -> B = ( Base ` L ) ) $.
mndpropd.3 $e |- ( ( ph /\ ( x e. B /\ y e. B ) ) -> ( x ( +g ` K ) y ) = ( x ( +g ` L ) y ) ) $.
mndpropd $p |- ( ph -> ( K e. Mnd <-> L e. Mnd ) ) $.
$d B x y $.
$d K x y $.
$d L x y $.
$d ph x y $.
